comments.value: On the ceremonies page there’s nothing in the promo boxes at the bottom, but they’re displaying the red cross in a box…I think they shouldn’t appear at all. Could you investigate?

This is happening because the template for that page expects to see a couple of subsections under Ceremonies (Getting Ready, Games Time, and Legacy), and it's trying to create links through to those sections. If you look at, say, Our Plans/Transport you'll see this working. Do you know if those sections used to exist and were deleted at some point?
I don't think they did for the Ceremonies page. can they be hidden?

subject: image boxes displaying wrongly
description: On the ceremonies page there’s nothing in the promo boxes at the bottom, but they’re displaying the red cross in a box…I think they shouldn’t appear at all. Could you investigate?

comments.value: This looks like a problem in the workflow

Need to check path in workflow, and if it lives in /galleries/ then republish the index page for that section.

* check that live and dev workflow aren't out of sync first

When an image gets added to a gallery it now publishes the Gallery index if this index had been published before. ( It also updates the navInclude for the image hub and publishes the image hub itself )

comments.value:
In this case it’s Liz'  But it’s in the page url.  Any way it could … not be? 
http://www.london2012.com/blog/contributors/liz-goulding.php

(check the name showing is surname not simply username)

It's using the 'name' field when it sets up that page, and not 'display-name' or a username - at least in all the tests I tried. Do you know where it's creating that page from? I had a quick look in workflow and web services and couldn't see anything. If you don't I'll have a proper trawl through them later. 

Actually, from a quick scan, it looks like newer pages have the name as their title and older ones have a string of numbers. This is based on a tiny sample! Might this have changed when we switched from /cms/ to /kit/
I've amended all of the existing contributor pages so that their names don't appear in the url. I'm looking into the cause of it now!
This ticket was closed and merged into ticket #77 "blog author surname".

Find attached the splash page we want to put in place in front of the normal home page this Friday morning to mark the fact that this weekend it is 3 years to go to the Paralympic Games.
 
Can get it up in time for Friday (28th) first thing.
 
see attached
/ flat html 
tech note: best to set it up / upload it as a standalone page / flat html and then setup a redirect to do a *temp* Alias to this page, in the redirects / .htaccess file in the root of the CMS

** BTW ** 

Don't enable the redirect just yet, just set it up (test with a lesser used page than the home page) and then leave commented out at the top so we can remove it first thing tomorrow (Fri 28th)

The page is up here: http://www.london2012.com/3-years-to-go/homepage/index.php

The redirect is ready to go and I'll set it going tomorrow am.

The Long description isn't showing short desc but is in the event interface

Culture event page
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/culture-events/family-fun-jazz-day.php
http://london2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/culture-events/family-fun-jazz-day.php

Event interface
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/culture-events/family-fun-jazz-day.php

Was only the Open Weekend template updated to show the Long Desc?

In the Cultural Olympiad event pages, the short description is high up in the header box, under the title of the event. It could very easily move down to underneath the listings info, if it wants to be consistent with the other event pages. It's quite long on some of the pages anyway.

Here's an example of it being over-long;
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/culture-events/airside.php

I'm happy for short descript to be moved below, but then we'd need a 'sub heading' field, which seems like lots of trouble.  can we just make sure the long descript field appears, and I'll get people to put the descriptions there, instead?
The long description field should be appearing now!

Lack of file extensions in image upload causes error
http://www.london2012.com/news/images/upload.php

Reported as still happening, need to investigate and fix

Problem image (sent by alex) attached
Can't reproduce error on Safari/Firefox need to test on IE

Can reproduce on IE7; gives the error 

You made a slight error in completing the form:
This file extention is not allowed!

when I try to upload the stadium image attached.

Hi

Please could we prioritise this bug and get it fixed today? We want to start soliciting for users images so we have some to use on Thursday.

Thanks

Alex
the file type ext. problem is now fixed
and fixed up IE styles

todo:

1)       Could we change the title of the page to ‘Send us your photos’ rather than ‘image upload’?
2)       Please could you change the name of the ‘image upload’ button to ‘Submit’
3)       Could we add the following legal statement and a tick box under the submit button:

Tick this box to confirm you are aware that by uploading your images, you agree that we may use them in accordance with our website’s Terms of Use, which can be viewed at http://www.london2012.com/terms-of-use.php . In particular, you confirm that we may use the images as if they were uploaded content in accordance with section 6 of our website’s Terms of Use and that you have the consent of anyone who is identifiable in the images or the consent of their parent/guardian if they are under 18 years old.

Could we also pull across the user's email address with the photo so that we have it incase we need to contact them? We wouldn't want the email to show up on the site though.

Please could we prioritise these enhancements to the image upload page to today? We want to use the page today and can't until these last remaining items are done.

Thanks!

Alex, the previous todos are all done now!

The username of the person that uploaded it should be stored on the image page it self in a field called UploadedBy. I'll do some testing on this now though.
Just to confirm, the username of the is beeing stored on the image page.

comments.value:
The text is from the original spec document by Jamie. My comments are in CAPS.

3.0 User submitted images and moderation
Creation of a new image upload page using the existing look and feel in order to enable
users to upload an image into the CMS. - OK. THIS WORKS
In addition to an image (under 1MB) the user will be able to enter the following fields when
submitting their image.
• Name - WHERE IS THIS STORED?
• Email - APPEARS TO BE OBTAINED FROM LOGIN AND PRESERVED AS "OWNER". IS THAT SUFFICIENT?
• Description - APPEARS TO BRE STORED AS "Caption"
• Title - APEARS TO BE STORED AS "Alt"
• Date photo taken - OK
• Postcode (not geocode) - APPEARS NOT TO BE WORKING
• Image (JPG < 1MB) - OK

Post moderation images a page will be created for the image and published as per the
workflow for image arriving in the Getty feed. It will additionally be possible to add user
submitted images to manually created galleries using the same mechanism that is cur-
rently used to move images that have arrived from Getty.

OK

User generated images will be tagged with the email address/name of the user uploading
the image so they can easily be identified en mass in future.

CAN YOU CONFIRM HOW THIS IS BEING PRESERVED?

It is not clear whether a user has to be logged in first to upload an image, for the purpose
of this document we will assume not.

IT LOOKS LIKE THIS HAS CHANGED NOW, AS LOGIN IS NOW REQUIRED..

Deliverables:
• new template and form to allow users to upload image OK
• back end moderation tool to allow images to be moderated - OK
• Updating of exiting image template to allow name of user who uploaded the image to additionally be stored. - THIS LOOKS LIKE ITS BEEN OVERLOOKED
• workﬂow and publication rules to resize, create pages for and publish user submitted images - LOOKS OK

COMMENTS:
The approval queue is a bit confusing as it is hard to tell what state an uploaded image is in. It would be very helpful if we had something like for blog comments.

changed the button name and headline

fixed: 
postcode get copied to image page metadata
mimetype checks (  but this would be nice to be changed to be reading actual exif image data )
you need to be logged in to upload an image and the image pages now store the username of that person in a field called uploader

subject: 2012: Image upload testing
description:
The text is from the original spec document by Jamie. My comments are in CAPS.

3.0 User submitted images and moderation
Creation of a new image upload page using the existing look and feel in order to enable
users to upload an image into the CMS. - OK. THIS WORKS
In addition to an image (under 1MB) the user will be able to enter the following fields when
submitting their image.
• Name - WHERE IS THIS STORED?
• Email - APPEARS TO BE OBTAINED FROM LOGIN AND PRESERVED AS "OWNER". IS THAT SUFFICIENT?
• Description - APPEARS TO BRE STORED AS "Caption"
• Title - APEARS TO BE STORED AS "Alt"
��� Date photo taken - OK
• Postcode (not geocode) - APPEARS NOT TO BE WORKING
• Image (JPG < 1MB) - OK

Post moderation images a page will be created for the image and published as per the
workflow for image arriving in the Getty feed. It will additionally be possible to add user
submitted images to manually created galleries using the same mechanism that is cur-
rently used to move images that have arrived from Getty.

OK

User generated images will be tagged with the email address/name of the user uploading
the image so they can easily be identified en mass in future.

CAN YOU CONFIRM HOW THIS IS BEING PRESERVED?

It is not clear whether a user has to be logged in first to upload an image, for the purpose
of this document we will assume not.

IT LOOKS LIKE THIS HAS CHANGED NOW, AS LOGIN IS NOW REQUIRED..

Deliverables:
• new template and form to allow users to upload image OK
• back end moderation tool to allow images to be moderated - OK
• Updating of exiting image template to allow name of user who uploaded the image to additionally be stored. - THIS LOOKS LIKE ITS BEEN OVERLOOKED
• workﬂow and publication rules to resize, create pages for and publish user submitted images - LOOKS OK

COMMENTS:
The approval queue is a bit confusing as it is hard to tell what state an uploaded image is in. It would be very helpful if we had something like for blog comments.

Looks a fairly trivial change, any chance you could get it in today..

Can you let the following people know once this is live an tested.

shawn@stamen.com, Liz.Goulding@london2012.com, mike@stamen.com, tom@stamen.com

Any questions speak to Shawn shawn@stamen.com

ta
